An **orcish shield** is a type of [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and appears as a **red-eyed shield** when unidentified.

The [Uruk-hai shield](/wiki/Uruk-hai_shield "Uruk-hai shield") is a near-identical shield with a different appearance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [6.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters start the game with knowledge of the orcish shield.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) A line of code is present that gives orcish characters in roles that start with [small shields](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") an orcish shield instead, and while this line is the only racial substitution for shields that is not commented out, there are currently no applicable roles.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") have a 1⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an orcish shield, and [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Mordor orc armor, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with orcish shields.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Description

While worn, an orcish shield grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Shield#Strategy](/wiki/Shield#Strategy "Shield")*

Orcish shields are heavier than [small shields](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") while providing the same amount of AC, and significantly inhibits [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") more than the small shield does. An orcish shield may suffice to fill out the shield slot momentarily, but should ideally be replaced with a lighter or better shield as soon as possible.

The orcish shield is particularly useful as [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") for [racial conducts](/wiki/Unofficial_conduct#Racial "Unofficial conduct") involving orcs.

## History

The orcish shield first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Sauron](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sauron "wikipedia:Sauron")***

The red eye is the symbol of Sauron, the title character and main antagonist of [J. R. R. Tolkien](/wiki/J._R._R._Tolkien "J. R. R. Tolkien")'s *The Lord of the Rings*. Sauron's forces included armies upon armies of [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)"), whose shields all bear the red-eye symbol as a mark of their servitude to him - the [Uruks of Mordor](/wiki/Uruk-Hai "Uruk-Hai") that serve the wizard Saruman are a notable exception, as their shields bear the White Hand of Saruman, which was a deliberate imitation of Sauron's red eye.

## Variants

Some variants may further distinguish the orcish and Uruk-hai shields, and others give [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") (including orcish characters) an AC bonus for wearing orcish shields.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), orcish shields can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into [elven shields](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield"), and upgrading an elven shield produces either an orcish shield or an Uruk-hai shield, with an equal chance of each item.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), orcish shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), an orcish shield grants 1 AC and 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") when worn. Like all shields, orcish shields add their full enchantment to AC while giving no bonus to DR.

[The Shield of the All-Seeing](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Shield_of_the_All-Seeing "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") orcish shield that favors orcs and can be enchanted to +7. While worn, it grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") along with [searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching"), adds its enchantment as a bonus to search attempts, and warns of [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") and [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion"). [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") the artifact cures [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") and [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination"), and grants [blindness](/wiki/Blindness_resistance "Blindness resistance") and [hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance"), [protection from shape changers](/wiki/Protection_from_shape_changers "Protection from shape changers"), and [x-ray vision](/wiki/X-ray_vision "X-ray vision") for 30 turns (or 40 if your base race is an orc).

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), orcish shields do not count as bulky for purposes of spellcasting penalties, while Uruk-hai shields do.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), orcish shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters. Orcish [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start each game with an orcish shield.

[Goblin outriders](/wiki/Goblin_outrider "Goblin outrider") and [goblin-captains](/wiki/Goblin-captain "Goblin-captain") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an orcish shield, and various [orcish](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") may generate with an orcish shield.

An orcish shield can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining [orcish boots](/wiki/Orcish_boots "Orcish boots") and an [orcish helm](/wiki/Orcish_helm "Orcish helm"). Orcish shields can be used to forge a few items:

- An orcish shield can be combined with [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail") to create [orcish chain mail](/wiki/Orcish_chain_mail "Orcish chain mail").
- An orcish shield can be combined with an orcish helm to create [orcish ring mail](/wiki/Orcish_ring_mail "Orcish ring mail").
- Two orcish shields can be combined to create an Uruk-hai shield.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), orcish shields grant +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including player orcs.

Upgrading an orcish shield will produce a [dwarvish roundshield](/wiki/Dwarvish_roundshield "Dwarvish roundshield"), and vice versa.

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 219](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L219)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L402): *armor and weapons for Mordor orc*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 400](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L400): *switch for orc-captains*
